answers.answer: I've never heard of someone transferring a growing embryo from one woman's body to another. Since the egg has implanted into your uterus, I would think that attempting to transfer it would in turn abort the baby.
This would be a question for a doctor. It seems unlikely, but maybe they can suggest other options for your friend.

I personally have never heard of this being able to happen. This is why an Ectopic pregnancy can not be removed from the tubes and then put into the uterus. Definitely talk to a doctor about it and see what they say. It's also possible if you are not wanting to keep the child that you could carry it and then they adopt it after.

question: I already have two children but I am pregnant. A friend of mine has no children. She is unable to conceive - she has PCOS and mild diabetes. Can my embryo be transferred to her womb so she can carry the pregnancy to term?Can I get sterilized at the same time.By what time (from conception) should this ideally be done?Approximately what will it cost in Mumbai, India?
title: Embryo Transfer Possible?
